channel.title: Comments on: My New Book on Graph Databases

item.title: By: jim
item.dc:creator: jim
item.description:
Hi Michael,
See Ian Robinson's post about running the examples in the book, where he covers indexes:
http://iansrobinson.com/2013/06/11/running-the-graph-databases-bookexamples/
Jim
item.content:encoded:
Hi Michael,

See Ian Robinson’s post about running the examples in the book, where he covers indexes:

http://iansrobinson.com/2013/06/11/running-the-graph-databases-bookexamples/

Jim

item.title: By: jim
item.dc:creator: jim
item.description:
Hi Kenneth,
There are many Neo4j tutorials happening across Germany. Keep an eye on http://www.neotechnology.com/calendar/ for announcements.
Good luck with porting your app!
Jim
item.content:encoded:
Hi Kenneth,

There are many Neo4j tutorials happening across Germany. Keep an eye on http://www.neotechnology.com/calendar/ for announcements.

Good luck with porting your app!

Jim

item.title: By: Kenneth onwuemene
item.dc:creator: Kenneth onwuemene
item.description: I started studying neo4j about a month ago, very soon, i will rewrite one of my apps using it. U and ur colleagues are doing a good job. I plan travelling to germany before end of the year, and will like to training in neo4j in germany, how possible is that?
item.content:encoded:
I started studying neo4j about a month ago, very soon, i will rewrite one of my apps using it.
U and ur colleagues are doing a good job.
I plan travelling to germany before end of the year, and will like to training in neo4j in germany, how possible is that?

item.title: By: Michael Mason
item.dc:creator: Michael Mason
item.description:
I am working through the examples in the Graph database book but came up against a problem with querying the Shakespeare graph using START theater=node:venue(name='Theatre Royal'), newcastle=node:city(name='Newcastle'), bard=node:author(lastname='Shakespeare') MATCH (newcastle)<-[:STREET|CITY*1..2]-(theater) ()-[:PRODUCTION_OF]-> (play)<-[:WROTE_PLAY]-(bard) RETURN DISTINCT play.title AS play It kept complaining about the missing author index. Also the console appears to only take a line at a time. Is there another way to import multi lined create statements other than through the console.
Thanks for opportunity to experiment with a graph database.
item.content:encoded:
I am working through the examples in the Graph database book but came up against a problem with querying the Shakespeare graph using
START theater=node:venue(name=’Theatre Royal’),
newcastle=node:city(name=’Newcastle’),
bard=node:author(lastname=’Shakespeare’)
MATCH (newcastle)<-[:STREET|CITY*1..2]-(theater)
()-[:PRODUCTION_OF]->
(play)<-[:WROTE_PLAY]-(bard)
RETURN DISTINCT play.title AS play
It kept complaining about the missing author index. Also the console appears to only take a line at a time. Is there another way to import multi lined create statements other than through the console.

Thanks for opportunity to experiment with a graph database.

item.title: By: jim
item.dc:creator: jim
item.content:encoded:
@Carl

I’ve asked our marketing folks to follow up with you offline.

Jim

item.content:encoded: I filled out the form but never got the download link for the book.
